attributes.action: take substantive action to facilitate, and implement, the ending of the terms "honourable" and "right honourable member" as automatically used in the House of Commons by MPs to address each other.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Recent events have shown that we cannot assume that all members of parliament are indeed honourable. Just as it would be wrong to tar all members with the same brush, it is equally wrong to assume that every MP is worthy of being addressed as honourable. The House adopting the measure above would avoid this difficulty, as well as indicating to the voters a fitting sense of contrition and humility.

rejection.details:
This is a matter for Parliament: 
http://www.parliament.uk
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
